info.title: Expense Report Service
info.description: Expense Report Service (ERS) is the next-generation v4 API for operations related to creating and processing Expense Reports. In order to interact with this API, a client must include either an authorized User or Company JWT in the header of each request, or use an X.509 client certificate with a CN included in the Allowed List by the ERS team.

tags.name: Expense Attendees
tags.description: Operations related to association of attendees with expenses

parameters.description: If true, the previous workflow instance will be returned instead of the current one

400.description:
Specified context not supported,
Invalid reportId,
Incorrect sub workflow process instance id in the request, does not belong to current workflow process instance,
Process instance id cannot be null or empty,
Completed process instance cannot be updated,
Missing steps in the request. If the intention was to delete a step, the step should be specified in the request with the is_deleted flag as true,
Incorrect number of sub workflows in request. The count should match existing sub workflows since sub workflows (like cost object) cannot be added or removed during update,
Step instance id may be null only for new user-added steps,
Approver is required for all user-added steps,
Is deleted flag cannot be true for a new user-added step,
Incorrect step instance id in the request, does not belong to current workflow process instance,
Incorrect sequence order for deleted step, only steps after the current workflow sequence can be deleted,
Incorrect sequence order for new user-added step, new step can be added only after the current workflow sequence

get.summary: Gets the reports for the specified user
get.description:
Returns the reports for the specified user. Also returns a self link.

The sort works as follows.
    When status is specified as 'ACTIVE':
    The returned reports are sorted into three groups:
        1. Returned or recalled reports
        2. Unsubmitted reports
        3. All other reports
    Within each group, reports are sorted on reportDate in the order specified by the user.
    The user-specified column on which to sort has no effect in this case.
When any status value other than 'ACTIVE' is specified:
    The returned reports are sorted on the user-specified column, in the user-specified order.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Report status filter

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Start date of date range filter. Format: YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: End date of date range filter. Format: YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: reportType
parameters.description: Report type filter

parameters.name: pagingRequestParams
parameters.description: Paging parameters values for the results

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The name of the column on which to sort

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Sort order
